Why Is My Cat So Jacked.subtitle: React Native App/Website
Why Is My Cat So Jacked.blurb: This is my first attempt at building a React Native app. I started this project on Saturday, Nov. 12th, 2022. See the current exported site here, or check out the Android dev app using Expo:

link.alt: Link to GitHub repository for this website

This Website :).subtitle: NextJS Website
This Website :).blurb: This is Version 3 of this site, finally fully in ReactJS (specificially NextJS)! This version uses the same design from V2, but offers cleaner code and better functionality.

link.alt: Link to GitHub repository for this website

Fiddlesitters Website.subtitle: NextJS Website
Fiddlesitters Website.blurb: A work-in-progress hub for our Twitch stream team, this website was built entirely using React and NextJS. The site is currently not live due to server costs, but is an active project for me! This is where I've explored connecting a website to a MySQL database to create an interactive game.

link.alt: Link to GitHub repository for Fiddlesitters website

Jackbox Spinner Wheel.subtitle: HTML/JS/CSS Mini-Project
Jackbox Spinner Wheel.blurb: My friends and I found that we were often unable to decide on what Jackbox game we wanted to play, so I threw some of our favorites into a wheel we can spin. ReactJS updates to come!

Time Conversion Calculator.subtitle: HTML/JS/CSS Mini-Project
Time Conversion Calculator.blurb: At work, a lot of our team found time zones and DST very confusing when scheduling tests to run in A/B testing apps (such as Dynamic Yield). I built a calculator to make scheduling tests easier and remove the trouble of having to think about time zones. The below link also has a TypeScript version.

Voyage of the Dead.subtitle: Video Game by Gaming Corps
Voyage of the Dead.blurb: This video game (PS4/Xbox One) featured light gun peripherals, which made it an extremely unique development process. As Developer Support, I programmed the Kraken boss fight, lobby fidgets, and other varioius encounters throughout the game, in addition to managing the full QA process.

link.alt: link to article about game release

American Ninja Warrior Challenge.subtitle: Video Game by Gaming Corps
American Ninja Warrior Challenge.blurb: This video game (PS4/Xbox One/Nintendo Switch) was developed alongside Voyage of the Dead by the same team at Gaming Corps Austin. My role for this project was primarily focused on testing console builds. I occasionally supported other parts of the development and design process, including assisting with set decoration.

link.alt: link to article about game release

Guildie Bot.subtitle: First Code Project - Discord Bot
Guildie Bot.blurb: Guildie Bot was my vehicle for learning JavaScript and MySQL. Originally designed simply to welcome new members into a Discord server, Guildie Bot grew into a full, text-based adventure game with the support of an AWS database.

link.alt: Link to Bitbucket repository for Guildie Bot

Catra, Adora, Dina, & Ellie Bots.subtitle: Discord Bots
Catra, Adora, Dina, & Ellie Bots.blurb: Based on characters from She-Ra and the Last of Us II, these bots work together to manage member roles and other various functions for my current public and private Discord servers.

link.alt: Link to Bitbucket repository for Dina, Ellie, Catra, and Adora bots

Guild of Geeks Website.subtitle: WordPress Site (Ended in 2020)
Guild of Geeks Website.blurb: I originally built this website from scratch before moving it over to WordPress. This site was the main hub of information for my non-profit organization, focusing especially on sharing upcoming events to help the organization grow in the local community.

link.alt: Link to Bitbucket repository for Guild of Geeks website
